scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Come, Dromio, come, these jests are out of season;
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Reserve them till a merrier hour than this.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Where is the gold I gave in charge to thee?
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: To me, sir? why, you gave no gold to me.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Come on, sir knave, have done your foolishness,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: And tell me how thou hast disposed thy charge.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: My charge was but to fetch you from the mart
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Home to your house, the Phoenix, sir, to dinner:
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: My mistress and her sister stays for you.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: In what safe place you have bestow'd my money,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Or I shall break that merry sconce of yours
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: That stands on tricks when I am undisposed:
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Where is the thousand marks thou hadst of me?
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: I have some marks of yours upon my pate,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Some of my mistress' marks upon my shoulders,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: But not a thousand marks between you both.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: If I should pay your worship those again,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Perchance you will not bear them patiently.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Thy mistress' marks? what mistress, slave, hast thou?
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Your worship's wife, my mistress at the Phoenix;
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: She that doth fast till you come home to dinner,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: And prays that you will hie you home to dinner.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: What, wilt thou flout me thus unto my face,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Being forbid? There, take you that, sir knave.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: What mean you, sir? for God's sake, hold your hands!
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Nay, and you will not, sir, I'll take my heels.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Upon my life, by some device or other
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: The villain is o'er-raught of all my money.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: They say this town is full of cozenage,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: As, nimble jugglers that deceive the eye,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Dark-working sorcerers that change the mind,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Soul-killing witches that deform the body,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Disguised cheaters, prating mountebanks,
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: And many such-like liberties of sin:
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: If it prove so, I will be gone the sooner.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: I'll to the Centaur, to go seek this slave:
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: I greatly fear my money is not safe.
scene_title: SCENE II.  The Mart.

line_text: Neither my husband nor the slave return'd,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: That in such haste I sent to seek his master!
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Perhaps some merchant hath invited him,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: And from the mart he's somewhere gone to dinner.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Good sister, let us dine and never fret:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: A man is master of his liberty:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Time is their master, and, when they see time,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: They'll go or come: if so, be patient, sister.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Why should their liberty than ours be more?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Because their business still lies out o' door.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Look, when I serve him so, he takes it ill.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: O, know he is the bridle of your will.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: There's none but asses will be bridled so.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Why, headstrong liberty is lash'd with woe.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: There's nothing situate under heaven's eye
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: But hath his bound, in earth, in sea, in sky:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: The beasts, the fishes, and the winged fowls,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Are their males' subjects and at their controls:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Men, more divine, the masters of all these,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Lords of the wide world and wild watery seas,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Indued with intellectual sense and souls,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Of more preeminence than fish and fowls,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Are masters to their females, and their lords:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Then let your will attend on their accords.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: This servitude makes you to keep unwed.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Not this, but troubles of the marriage-bed.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: But, were you wedded, you would bear some sway.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Ere I learn love, I'll practise to obey.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: How if your husband start some other where?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Till he come home again, I would forbear.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Patience unmoved! no marvel though she pause;
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: They can be meek that have no other cause.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: A wretched soul, bruised with adversity,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: We bid be quiet when we hear it cry;
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: But were we burdened with like weight of pain,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: As much or more would we ourselves complain:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: So thou, that hast no unkind mate to grieve thee,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: With urging helpless patience wouldst relieve me,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: But, if thou live to see like right bereft,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: This fool-begg'd patience in thee will be left.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Well, I will marry one day, but to try.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Here comes your man; now is your husband nigh.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Say, is your tardy master now at hand?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Nay, he's at two hands with me, and that my two ears
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: can witness.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Say, didst thou speak with him? know'st thou his mind?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Ay, ay, he told his mind upon mine ear:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Beshrew his hand, I scarce could understand it.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Spake he so doubtfully, thou couldst not feel his meaning?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Nay, he struck so plainly, I could too well feel his
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: blows; and withal so doubtfully that I could scarce
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: understand them.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: But say, I prithee, is he coming home? It seems he
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: hath great care to please his wife.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Why, mistress, sure my master is horn-mad.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Horn-mad, thou villain!
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: I mean not cuckold-mad;
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: But, sure, he is stark mad.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: When I desired him to come home to dinner,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: He ask'd me for a thousand marks in gold:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: ''Tis dinner-time,' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he;
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: 'Your meat doth burn,' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: 'Will you come home?' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: 'Where is the thousand marks I gave thee, villain?'
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: 'The pig,' quoth I, 'is burn'd;' 'My gold!' quoth he:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: 'My mistress, sir' quoth I; 'Hang up thy mistress!
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: I know not thy mistress; out on thy mistress!'
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Quoth who?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Quoth my master:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: 'I know,' quoth he, 'no house, no wife, no mistress.'
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: So that my errand, due unto my tongue,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: I thank him, I bare home upon my shoulders;
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: For, in conclusion, he did beat me there.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Go back again, thou slave, and fetch him home.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Go back again, and be new beaten home?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: For God's sake, send some other messenger.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Back, slave, or I will break thy pate across.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: And he will bless that cross with other beating:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Between you I shall have a holy head.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Hence, prating peasant! fetch thy master home.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Am I so round with you as you with me,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: That like a football you do spurn me thus?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: You spurn me hence, and he will spurn me hither:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: If I last in this service, you must case me in leather.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Fie, how impatience loureth in your face!
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: His company must do his minions grace,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Whilst I at home starve for a merry look.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Hath homely age the alluring beauty took
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: From my poor cheek? then he hath wasted it:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Are my discourses dull? barren my wit?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: If voluble and sharp discourse be marr'd,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Unkindness blunts it more than marble hard:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Do their gay vestments his affections bait?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: That's not my fault: he's master of my state:
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: What ruins are in me that can be found,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: By him not ruin'd? then is he the ground
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Of my defeatures. My decayed fair
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: A sunny look of his would soon repair
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: But, too unruly deer, he breaks the pale
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: And feeds from home; poor I am but his stale.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Self-harming jealousy! fie, beat it hence!
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Unfeeling fools can with such wrongs dispense.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: I know his eye doth homage otherwhere,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Or else what lets it but he would be here?
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Sister, you know he promised me a chain;
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Would that alone, alone he would detain,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: So he would keep fair quarter with his bed!
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: I see the jewel best enamelled
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Will lose his beauty; yet the gold bides still,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: That others touch, and often touching will
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Wear gold: and no man that hath a name,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: By falsehood and corruption doth it shame.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: Since that my beauty cannot please his eye,
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: I'll weep what's left away, and weeping die.
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: How many fond fools serve mad jealousy!
scene_title: SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.

line_text: The gold I gave to Dromio is laid up
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Safe at the Centaur; and the heedful slave
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Is wander'd forth, in care to seek me out
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: By computation and mine host's report.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: I could not speak with Dromio since at first
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: I sent him from the mart. See, here he comes.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: How now sir! is your merry humour alter'd?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: As you love strokes, so jest with me again.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: You know no Centaur? you received no gold?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Your mistress sent to have me home to dinner?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: My house was at the Phoenix? Wast thou mad,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: That thus so madly thou didst answer me?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: What answer, sir? when spake I such a word?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Even now, even here, not half an hour since.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: I did not see you since you sent me hence,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Home to the Centaur, with the gold you gave me.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Villain, thou didst deny the gold's receipt,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: And told'st me of a mistress and a dinner;
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: For which, I hope, thou felt'st I was displeased.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: I am glad to see you in this merry vein:
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: What means this jest? I pray you, master, tell me.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Yea, dost thou jeer and flout me in the teeth?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Think'st thou I jest? Hold, take thou that, and that.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Hold, sir, for God's sake! now your jest is earnest:
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Upon what bargain do you give it me?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Because that I familiarly sometimes
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Do use you for my fool and chat with you,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Your sauciness will jest upon my love
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: And make a common of my serious hours.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: When the sun shines let foolish gnats make sport,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: But creep in crannies when he hides his beams.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: If you will jest with me, know my aspect,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: And fashion your demeanor to my looks,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Or I will beat this method in your sconce.

line_text: Sconce call you it? so you would leave battering, I
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: had rather have it a head: an you use these blows
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: long, I must get a sconce for my head and ensconce
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: it too; or else I shall seek my wit in my shoulders.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: But, I pray, sir why am I beaten?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Dost thou not know?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Nothing, sir, but that I am beaten.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Shall I tell you why?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Ay, sir, and wherefore; for they say every why hath
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: a wherefore.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Why, first,--for flouting me; and then, wherefore--
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: For urging it the second time to me.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Was there ever any man thus beaten out of season,
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: When in the why and the wherefore is neither rhyme
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: nor reason?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Well, sir, I thank you.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Marry, sir, for this something that you gave me for nothing.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: I'll make you amends next, to give you nothing for
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: something. But say, sir, is it dinner-time?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: No, sir; I think the meat wants that I have.
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: In good time, sir; what's that?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Basting.

scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Your reason?
scene_title: SCENE II.  A public place.

line_text: Lest it make you choleric and purchase me another

line_text: Well, sir, learn to jest in good time: there's a

line_text: And pay the sum that may deliver me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Speak freely, Syracusian, what thou wilt.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Is not your name, sir, call'd Antipholus?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And is not that your bondman, Dromio?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Within this hour I was his bondman sir,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: But he, I thank him, gnaw'd in two my cords:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Now am I Dromio and his man unbound.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I am sure you both of you remember me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Ourselves we do remember, sir, by you;
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: For lately we were bound, as you are now
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: You are not Pinch's patient, are you, sir?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Why look you strange on me? you know me well.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: O, grief hath changed me since you saw me last,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And careful hours with time's deformed hand
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Have written strange defeatures in my face:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: But tell me yet, dost thou not know my voice?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Neither.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Dromio, nor thou?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: No, trust me, sir, nor I.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I am sure thou dost.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Ay, sir, but I am sure I do not; and whatsoever a
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: man denies, you are now bound to believe him.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Not know my voice! O time's extremity,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Hast thou so crack'd and splitted my poor tongue
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: In seven short years, that here my only son
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Knows not my feeble key of untuned cares?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Though now this grained face of mine be hid
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: In sap-consuming winter's drizzled snow,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And all the conduits of my blood froze up,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Yet hath my night of life some memory,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: My wasting lamps some fading glimmer left,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: My dull deaf ears a little use to hear:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: All these old witnesses--I cannot err--
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Tell me thou art my son Antipholus.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I never saw my father in my life.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: But seven years since, in Syracusa, boy,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Thou know'st we parted: but perhaps, my son,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Thou shamest to acknowledge me in misery.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: The duke and all that know me in the city
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Can witness with me that it is not so
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I ne'er saw Syracusa in my life.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I tell thee, Syracusian, twenty years
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Have I been patron to Antipholus,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: During which time he ne'er saw Syracusa:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I see thy age and dangers make thee dote.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Most mighty duke, behold a man much wrong'd.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I see two husbands, or mine eyes deceive me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: One of these men is Genius to the other;
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And so of these. Which is the natural man,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And which the spirit? who deciphers them?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I, sir, am Dromio; command him away.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I, sir, am Dromio; pray, let me stay.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: AEgeon art thou not? or else his ghost?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: O, my old master! who hath bound him here?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Whoever bound him, I will loose his bonds
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And gain a husband by his liberty.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Speak, old AEgeon, if thou be'st the man
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: That hadst a wife once call'd AEmilia
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: That bore thee at a burden two fair sons:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: O, if thou be'st the same AEgeon, speak,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And speak unto the same AEmilia!
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: If I dream not, thou art AEmilia:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: If thou art she, tell me where is that son
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: That floated with thee on the fatal raft?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: By men of Epidamnum he and I
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And the twin Dromio all were taken up;
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: But by and by rude fishermen of Corinth
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: By force took Dromio and my son from them
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And me they left with those of Epidamnum.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: What then became of them I cannot tell
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I to this fortune that you see me in.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Why, here begins his morning story right;
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: These two Antipholuses, these two so like,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And these two Dromios, one in semblance,--
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Besides her urging of her wreck at sea,--
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: These are the parents to these children,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Which accidentally are met together.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Antipholus, thou camest from Corinth first?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: No, sir, not I; I came from Syracuse.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Stay, stand apart; I know not which is which.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I came from Corinth, my most gracious lord,--
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And I with him.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Brought to this town by that most famous warrior,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Duke Menaphon, your most renowned uncle.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Which of you two did dine with me to-day?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I, gentle mistress.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And are not you my husband?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: No; I say nay to that.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And so do I; yet did she call me so:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And this fair gentlewoman, her sister here,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Did call me brother.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: What I told you then,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I hope I shall have leisure to make good;
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: If this be not a dream I see and hear.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: That is the chain, sir, which you had of me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I think it be, sir; I deny it not.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And you, sir, for this chain arrested me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I think I did, sir; I deny it not.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I sent you money, sir, to be your bail,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: By Dromio; but I think he brought it not.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: No, none by me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: This purse of ducats I received from you,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And Dromio, my man, did bring them me.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I see we still did meet each other's man,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And I was ta'en for him, and he for me,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And thereupon these errors are arose.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: These ducats pawn I for my father here.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: It shall not need; thy father hath his life.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Sir, I must have that diamond from you.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: There, take it; and much thanks for my good cheer.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Renowned duke, vouchsafe to take the pains
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: To go with us into the abbey here
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And hear at large discoursed all our fortunes:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And all that are assembled in this place,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: That by this sympathized one day's error
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Have suffer'd wrong, go keep us company,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And we shall make full satisfaction.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Thirty-three years have I but gone in travail
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Of you, my sons; and till this present hour
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: My heavy burden ne'er delivered.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: The duke, my husband and my children both,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And you the calendars of their nativity,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Go to a gossips' feast and go with me;
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: After so long grief, such festivity!
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: With all my heart, I'll gossip at this feast.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Master, shall I fetch your stuff from shipboard?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Dromio, what stuff of mine hast thou embark'd?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Your goods that lay at host, sir, in the Centaur.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: He speaks to me. I am your master, Dromio:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Come, go with us; we'll look to that anon:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Embrace thy brother there; rejoice with him.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: There is a fat friend at your master's house,
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: That kitchen'd me for you to-day at dinner:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: She now shall be my sister, not my wife.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Methinks you are my glass, and not my brother:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: I see by you I am a sweet-faced youth.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Will you walk in to see their gossiping?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Not I, sir; you are my elder.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: That's a question: how shall we try it?
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: We'll draw cuts for the senior: till then lead thou first.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: Nay, then, thus:
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: We came into the world like brother and brother;
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.

line_text: And now let's go hand in hand, not one before another.
scene_title: SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.
